item.title: when the traders next to you are insanely noisy that it makes you think your airpods noise cancelling thing isn’t on so you pressed your airpod to turn it on but actually you’re turning it off and the noise hits you like a mf
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description: when the traders next to you are insanely noisy that it makes you think your airpods noise cancelling thing isn’t on so you pressed your airpod to turn it on but actually you’re turning it off and the noise hits you like a mf

item.title: this is not that surprising. from my very deep knowledge I know that some firms use “fill-or-kill” orders when trading. if their orders don’t get filled the firm will force them to kill someone. look it up it’s 100% true.
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
this is not that surprising. from my very deep knowledge I know that some firms use “fill-or-kill” orders when trading. if their orders don’t get filled the firm will force them to kill someone. look it up it’s 100% true.

nitter.freedit.eu/deedydas/status/1882104649668530586#m

item.title:
R to @quantymacro: if you’re transparent about your exp/knowledge, do good work, ask good questions, you’ll possibly be known as the kid in the arena & get a lot of goodwill & guidance from smarter ppl
but you choose to larp instead to get clout from 18yos hardos
brainless fr
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
if you’re transparent about your exp/knowledge, do good work, ask good questions, you’ll possibly be known as the kid in the arena & get a lot of goodwill & guidance from smarter ppl

but you choose to larp instead to get clout from 18yos hardos

brainless fr

item.title:
who would’ve known the legions of “just-do-things”-“cracked”-“entrepreneurial”-20yos who constantly brag abt how rich & prodigious they are turn out to be larpers
if you’re larping as something it’s bcs you know you’ll never get there even w all your might
weak stuffs fr

item.title:
R to @quantymacro: real talk I learned a lot about things that are not necessarily “new”, but more about using pre-existing stuffs in a more conscientious way to fit better models, combining forecasts, evaluating signals etc.
also a lot of other new stuffs actually.
10/10 no notes
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
real talk I learned a lot about things that are not necessarily “new”, but more about using pre-existing stuffs in a more conscientious way to fit better models, combining forecasts, evaluating signals etc.

also a lot of other new stuffs actually.

10/10 no notes

item.title:
meeting of the macro accounts
felt like I was in a flirting with models episode but I get to decide the questions to ask
and good to know once you work long enough in the industry you can afford SIM card with 5G and better drinks than Sainsbury Evian
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro

item.title:
I may have been too hard on a certain someone who launched a shitcoin and then rugged their followers.
turns out they were just front running the leader of the free world. I apologise for my hasty judgment.
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
I may have been too hard on a certain someone who launched a shitcoin and then rugged their followers.

turns out they were just front running the leader of the free world. I apologise for my hasty judgment.

item.title:
best news to receive on a Saturday is someone who asked you about breaking into quant/macro ends up in entrepreneurship or tech.
worst news to receive on a Saturday is someone who asked you about breaking into quant/macro ends up in investment banking or fundamental equities.
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
best news to receive on a Saturday is someone who asked you about breaking into quant/macro ends up in entrepreneurship or tech.

worst news to receive on a Saturday is someone who asked you about breaking into quant/macro ends up in investment banking or fundamental equities.

item.title: me throwing a bunch of features into my ML model to find something that sticks
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description: me throwing a bunch of features into my ML model to find something that sticks

item.title:
today I had the fortune of going through banks’ papers/articles and see how they run regressions to create their rates “fair value model”
turns out there are tons of regressions w 90% R2 out there. I think I should ask to borrow some then maybe I can crawl out of this drawdown
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
today I had the fortune of going through banks’ papers/articles and see how they run regressions to create their rates “fair value model”

turns out there are tons of regressions w 90% R2 out there. I think I should ask to borrow some then maybe I can crawl out of this drawdown

item.title:
R to @quantymacro: ngl to say I’m disappointed is probs an understatement. the only silver lining is it wasn’t an error — the strategy did what it was designed to & got rekt
hopefully in a few months things recover Inshallah
if you ever took quant advice from me pls save yourself
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
ngl to say I’m disappointed is probs an understatement. the only silver lining is it wasn’t an error — the strategy did what it was designed to & got rekt

hopefully in a few months things recover Inshallah

if you ever took quant advice from me pls save yourself

item.title: fold a finger if you spent months researching your own strategies and convincing your PM that you know what you’re doing then he asked you to paper trade it and you absolutely blew it up with 60% vol drawdown and it’s only mid January
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description: fold a finger if you spent months researching your own strategies and convincing your PM that you know what you’re doing then he asked you to paper trade it and you absolutely blew it up with 60% vol drawdown and it’s only mid January

item.title:
and I still haven’t turned on the heater yet
you can guess my bonus from that
don’t do systematic macro kids just go join HFT

item.title: question for immigrants in the UK who’s not planning to stay here forever: are you contributing to/maxxing pension? is it worth it? what are the things I need to be aware of/consider? I see/hear conflicting things from ppl ard me so I’m asking the wisdom of the crowd
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description: question for immigrants in the UK who’s not planning to stay here forever: are you contributing to/maxxing pension? is it worth it? what are the things I need to be aware of/consider? I see/hear conflicting things from ppl ard me so I’m asking the wisdom of the crowd

item.title:
the multiplication table 12 has always been hard for me. for the life of me I can’t memorise it. I only can memorise up until 12x5=60. if I wanna calculate 12x8, I have to do 12x5 + 12 + 12 + 12=96 in my head to get the answer.
I’m a quant btw
item.dc:creator: @quantymacro
item.description:
the multiplication table 12 has always been hard for me. for the life of me I can’t memorise it. I only can memorise up until 12x5=60. if I wanna calculate 12x8, I have to do 12x5 + 12 + 12 + 12=96 in my head to get the answer.

I’m a quant btw

item.title:
was (re)-listening to this episode. Aspect Systematic Macro uses a highkey very similar approach that Isichenko mentioned in the book. will update the article later to include this
but don’t bother joining systematic macro kids it doesn’t make money go join HFT instead

item.title: the moment I drop my very deep knowledge on this site it's literally over for yall. the hedge fund industry will grind to a halt. don't taunt me I'm not playing
